page.title: 05LARKHALL COUNCIL HOUSING
page.content: LARKHALL COUNCIL HOUSING IN GENERAL COUNCIL HOUSES ARE SEMI-DETACHED.IN TERMS OF HEATING USED COAL FIRES SEEM TO BE REPLACED BY MOSTLY GAS,BUT ALSO SOME ELECTRICAL CENTRAL HEATING,AND ONLY A FEW HOUSES HAVE CAVITY WALL INSULATION.MOST COUNCIL HOUSES SEEM TO BE SEMIDETACHED WITH DOTH FRONT AND REAR GARDENS.THE MAIN PROBLEMS IN THESE HOUSES SEEMS TO BE DAMPNESS AND CONDENSATION BUT THERE ARE VERY FEW COMPLANTS AMONG COUNCIL HOUSE DWELLERS.MOST HOUSES HAVE 2 OR 3 BEDROOMS AND SOMETIMES 4 WITH ONLY 1 TOILET.MOST PEOPLE ARE CONTENT WITH THEIR HOUSE AND FEEL THAT THEY HAVE BEEN WELL BUILT AND HAVE STAYED IN THEIR ORIGINAL CONDITION.IN GENERAL MOST PEOPLE FEEL THAT THEY HAVE AN ADEQUATE AT FRONT AND BACK.THE AVERAGE SIZE OF FAMILY USING THESE HOUSES COMPRISES OF 2 ADULTS AND 3 CHILDREN.
